items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Jul 22 - Jul 28, 2024
items.summary: 1 awesome projects updated on Jul 22 - Jul 28, 2024
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Radicle](https://radicle.xyz/) is an open source, peer-to-peer code collaboration stack built on Git. Unlike centralized code hosting platforms, there is no single entity controlling the network. Repositories are replicated across peers in a decentralized manner, and users are in full control of their data and workflow.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • Radicle is an open source, peer-to-peer code collaboration stack built on Git. Unlike centralized code hosting platforms, there is no single entity controlling the network. Repositories are replicated across peers in a decentralized manner, and users are in full control of their data and workflow.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Jul 10 - Jul 16, 2023
items.summary: 15 awesome projects updated on Jul 10 - Jul 16, 2023
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Airshare (‚≠ê652)](https://github.com/KuroLabs/Airshare): CLI tool and module for transferring data between 2 machines in a local network, P2P, using Multicast-DNS. Works completely offline.
*   [Element (formerly Riot)](https://element.io): Collaboration client for the web. Chat, VOIP video, file transfer, end-to-end crypto.
*   [Fred (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/hyphanet/fred): Freenet REference Daemon. Also: freenetproject.org
*   [Hardbin (‚≠ê254)](https://github.com/jes/hardbin): Encrypted pastebin using IPFS.
*   [ipfs-chat (‚≠ê143)](https://github.com/SomajitDey/ipfs-chat): Terminal-based, secure chatrooms using IPFS. Works over both LAN and internet (includes NAT traversal). Supports private-messaging and file/directory sharing.
*   [Keet](https://keet.io): Peer to peer video & chat. Private & encrypted. Share huge files instantly.
*   [Netsukuku (‚≠ê151)](https://github.com/Netsukuku/netsukuku): Netsukuku is an alternative to the internet; it will have all of the features of the internet, such as websites, instant messaging, file transfers, DNS, etc. It functions as a mesh network or a p2p net system that generates and sustains itself autonomously. It is designed to handle an unlimited number of nodes with minimal CPU and memory resources.
*   [NNTPChan (‚≠ê74)](https://github.com/majestrate/nntpchan): NNTP based decentralized imageboard.
*   [norcal](https://github.com/substack/norcal): P2P command-line calendar in Node.js. Can sync, link, embed, and edit offline.
*   [SecuShare](https://secushare.org): A research project. Consider that it basically consists of a new Internet stack combined with a full-fledged distributed scalability alternative to cloud technology. Source code: <https://gnunet.org/git/gnunet.git>
*   [SimpleX chat (‚≠ê9k)](https://github.com/simplex-chat/simplex-chat): A decentralized terminal-based chat (a mobile app coming soon) with a focus on users‚Äô privacy. It doesn't use any global user identities (not even random IDs), supports groups and sending files.
*   [ZeroNet](https://zeronet.io/): Open, free and uncensorable websites, using Bitcoin cryptography and BitTorrent network. Uncensored, no hosting costs, always accessible.
    communities with auditable moderation and mod elections.

### Other

*   [Hyphanet](https://hyphanet.org): Hyphanet is a peer-to-peer platform for censorship-resistant and privacy-respecting publishing and communication. The original Freenet.
*   [GNUnet](https://gnunet.org): GNUnet is a network protocol stack for building secure, distributed, and privacy-preserving applications. The Internet of tomorrow needs GNUnet today.
*   [Gun (‚≠ê19k)](https://github.com/amark/gun): A cybersecurity protocol for syncing decentralized graph data; GUN is an ecosystem of tools that let you build community run and encrypted applications - like an Open Source Firebase or a Decentralized Dropbox.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • Airshare (‚≠ê652): CLI tool and module for transferring data between 2 machines in a local network, P2P, using Multicast-DNS. Works completely offline.
  • Element (formerly Riot): Collaboration client for the web. Chat, VOIP video, file transfer, end-to-end crypto.
  • Fred (‚≠ê1.1k): Freenet REference Daemon. Also: freenetproject.org
  • Hardbin (‚≠ê254): Encrypted pastebin using IPFS.
  • ipfs-chat (‚≠ê143): Terminal-based, secure chatrooms using IPFS. Works over both LAN and internet (includes NAT traversal). Supports private-messaging and file/directory sharing.
  • Keet: Peer to peer video & chat. Private & encrypted. Share huge files instantly.
  • Netsukuku (‚≠ê151): Netsukuku is an alternative to the internet; it will have all of the features of the internet, such as websites, instant messaging, file transfers, DNS, etc. It functions as a mesh network or a p2p net system that generates and sustains itself autonomously. It is designed to handle an unlimited number of nodes with minimal CPU and memory resources.
  • NNTPChan (‚≠ê74): NNTP based decentralized imageboard.
  • norcal: P2P command-line calendar in Node.js. Can sync, link, embed, and edit offline.
  • SecuShare: A research project. Consider that it basically consists of a new Internet stack combined with a full-fledged distributed scalability alternative to cloud technology. Source code: https://gnunet.org/git/gnunet.git
  • SimpleX chat (‚≠ê9k): A decentralized terminal-based chat (a mobile app coming soon) with a focus on users‚Äô privacy. It doesn't use any global user identities (not even random IDs), supports groups and sending files.
  • ZeroNet: Open, free and uncensorable websites, using Bitcoin cryptography and BitTorrent network. Uncensored, no hosting costs, always accessible. communities with auditable moderation and mod elections.

Other

  • Hyphanet: Hyphanet is a peer-to-peer platform for censorship-resistant and privacy-respecting publishing and communication. The original Freenet.
  • GNUnet: GNUnet is a network protocol stack for building secure, distributed, and privacy-preserving applications. The Internet of tomorrow needs GNUnet today.
  • Gun (‚≠ê19k): A cybersecurity protocol for syncing decentralized graph data; GUN is an ecosystem of tools that let you build community run and encrypted applications - like an Open Source Firebase or a Decentralized Dropbox.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Apr 25 - May 01, 2022
items.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Apr 25 - May 01, 2022
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [SocialHome (‚≠ê369)](https://github.com/jaywink/socialhome): Federated personal profile with social networking functionality. Users can create rich content using Markdown and even HTML/JS/CSS. All content can be pinned to the user profile and all content will federate to contacts in the federated social web.
*   [Steemit](https://steemit.com/): Blockchain-based social media platform where anyone can earn rewards.
*   [Ticktack ‚ò† (‚≠ê56)](https://github.com/ticktackim/ticktack-workplan): Decentralized social platform for people to share knowledge and exchange value, with P2P messaging encrypted feature. Built on top of Secure Scuttlebutt (SSB).
items.content_html:
Applications

  • SocialHome (‚≠ê369): Federated personal profile with social networking functionality. Users can create rich content using Markdown and even HTML/JS/CSS. All content can be pinned to the user profile and all content will federate to contacts in the federated social web.
  • Steemit: Blockchain-based social media platform where anyone can earn rewards.
  • Ticktack ‚ò† (‚≠ê56): Decentralized social platform for people to share knowledge and exchange value, with P2P messaging encrypted feature. Built on top of Secure Scuttlebutt (SSB).

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Oct 18 - Oct 24, 2021
items.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Oct 18 - Oct 24, 2021
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Deltachat](https://delta.chat): Delta Chat is like Telegram or Whatsapp but without the tracking or central control. It doesn't have their own servers but uses the most massive and diverse open messaging system ever: the existing e-mail server network. Chat with anyone if you know their e-mail address, no need for them to install DeltaChat, all you need is a standard e-mail account.

### Other

*   [Solid](https://solidproject.org): Solid was created by the inventor of the World Wide Web, Sir Tim Berners-Lee. Solid is a specification that lets people store their data securely in decentralized data stores called Pods. Pods are like secure personal web servers for your data. For developer resources, see [Developer Resources](https://solidproject.org/developers). For a listing of some Solid applications, see [Solid Applications](https://solidproject.org/apps).
items.content_html:
Applications

  • Deltachat: Delta Chat is like Telegram or Whatsapp but without the tracking or central control. It doesn't have their own servers but uses the most massive and diverse open messaging system ever: the existing e-mail server network. Chat with anyone if you know their e-mail address, no need for them to install DeltaChat, all you need is a standard e-mail account.

Other

  • Solid: Solid was created by the inventor of the World Wide Web, Sir Tim Berners-Lee. Solid is a specification that lets people store their data securely in decentralized data stores called Pods. Pods are like secure personal web servers for your data. For developer resources, see Developer Resources. For a listing of some Solid applications, see Solid Applications.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Oct 04 - Oct 10, 2021
items.summary: 7 awesome projects updated on Oct 04 - Oct 10, 2021
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Agregore (‚≠ê840)](https://github.com/AgregoreWeb/agregore-browser): A minimalistic web browser that supports multiple peer-to-peer protocols and is extensible with standard WebExtensions.
*   [airpaste ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê825)](https://github.com/mafintosh/airpaste): A 1-1 network pipe that auto discovers other peers using mdns. Can send text or files.
*   [Friendica (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/friendica/friendica): Decentralised communications platform that integrates social communication. Connect effortlessly to a federated communications network of several thousand servers, with more than half a million users. Directly connect to anyone on Friendica, Mastodon, Diaspora, GnuSocial, Pleroma, or Hubzilla, regardless of where each user profile is hosted.
*   [LF (‚≠ê895)](https://github.com/zerotier/lf): Fully decentralized fully replicated key/value store. Fully decentralized means anyone can run a node without obtaining special permission, and all nodes are effectively equal. Fully replicated means every node stores all data.
*   [ShareDrop ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/cowbell/sharedrop): Clone of Apple AirDrop service. Allows transferring files directly between devices, without having to upload them to any server first.
*   [TheDistributedBay ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/TheDistributedBay/TheDistributedBay): P2P rewrite of the Open Bay/Pirate Bay. It uses a completely distributed protocol to share entries between numerous nodes. This makes it nearly impossible to take down by seizure of servers. Each node contains a complete copy, and any changes are propagated through the network.
*   [webcat ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê452)](https://github.com/mafintosh/webcat): P2P pipe across the web using webrtc that uses Github private/public key for authentication and a signalhub for discovery. Can send text or files.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • Agregore (‚≠ê840): A minimalistic web browser that supports multiple peer-to-peer protocols and is extensible with standard WebExtensions.
  • airpaste ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê825): A 1-1 network pipe that auto discovers other peers using mdns. Can send text or files.
  • Friendica (‚≠ê1.6k): Decentralised communications platform that integrates social communication. Connect effortlessly to a federated communications network of several thousand servers, with more than half a million users. Directly connect to anyone on Friendica, Mastodon, Diaspora, GnuSocial, Pleroma, or Hubzilla, regardless of where each user profile is hosted.
  • LF (‚≠ê895): Fully decentralized fully replicated key/value store. Fully decentralized means anyone can run a node without obtaining special permission, and all nodes are effectively equal. Fully replicated means every node stores all data.
  • ShareDrop ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê11k): Clone of Apple AirDrop service. Allows transferring files directly between devices, without having to upload them to any server first.
  • TheDistributedBay ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê28): P2P rewrite of the Open Bay/Pirate Bay. It uses a completely distributed protocol to share entries between numerous nodes. This makes it nearly impossible to take down by seizure of servers. Each node contains a complete copy, and any changes are propagated through the network.
  • webcat ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê452): P2P pipe across the web using webrtc that uses Github private/public key for authentication and a signalhub for discovery. Can send text or files.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on May 24 - May 30, 2021
items.summary: 11 awesome projects updated on May 24 - May 30, 2021
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Aether (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/aethereans/aether-app): P2P ephemeral public communities. Open source, self-governing
*   [Dropub ‚ò†Ô∏è](https://dropub.com): Share files for free on the internet. It's like Dropbox meets BitTorrent.
*   [Friends ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê3.2k)](https://github.com/moose-team/friends): P2P chat powered by the web. This project is alpha quality.
*   [Hyperpad (‚≠ê206)](https://github.com/hackergrrl/hyperpad): Peer-to-peer collaborative text editor.
*   [instant.io (‚≠ê3.5k)](https://github.com/webtorrent/instant.io): Streaming file transfer over WebTorrent (torrents on the web).
*   [IPFS bin ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê134)](https://github.com/victorb/ipfsbin): Pastebin application for sharing code and text documents to other people.
*   [IPFS Desktop (‚≠ê6.3k)](https://github.com/ipfs/ipfs-desktop): A native application to run your own IPFS Node.
*   [iWant ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê294)](https://github.com/nirvik/iWant): Commandline tool for searching and downloading files in LAN network, without any central server.
*   [ORC ‚ò†Ô∏è](https://orc.network/): Onion Routed Cloud, a decentralized, anonymous, file storage platform. It uses the Tor network.
*   [Peertransfer ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê327)](https://github.com/pguth/peertransfer): Send a file p2p and e2e encrypted using nothing but your browser.
*   [YaCy](https://yacy.net/): Free distributed search engine, built on principles of P2P networks.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • Aether (‚≠ê1.2k): P2P ephemeral public communities. Open source, self-governing
  • Dropub ‚ò†Ô∏è: Share files for free on the internet. It's like Dropbox meets BitTorrent.
  • Friends ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê3.2k): P2P chat powered by the web. This project is alpha quality.
  • Hyperpad (‚≠ê206): Peer-to-peer collaborative text editor.
  • instant.io (‚≠ê3.5k): Streaming file transfer over WebTorrent (torrents on the web).
  • IPFS bin ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê134): Pastebin application for sharing code and text documents to other people.
  • IPFS Desktop (‚≠ê6.3k): A native application to run your own IPFS Node.
  • iWant ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê294): Commandline tool for searching and downloading files in LAN network, without any central server.
  • ORC ‚ò†Ô∏è: Onion Routed Cloud, a decentralized, anonymous, file storage platform. It uses the Tor network.
  • Peertransfer ‚ò†Ô∏è (‚≠ê327): Send a file p2p and e2e encrypted using nothing but your browser.
  • YaCy: Free distributed search engine, built on principles of P2P networks.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Mar 15 - Mar 21, 2021
items.summary: 1 awesome projects updated on Mar 15 - Mar 21, 2021
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Cactus Comments](https://cactus.chat/): Federated comment system for the open web built on Matrix.
items.content_html:
Applications

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Jul 22 - Jul 28, 2019
items.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Jul 22 - Jul 28, 2019
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [croc (‚≠ê31k)](https://github.com/schollz/croc): Easily and securely send files and folders from one computer to another in command line.
*   [Jami](https://jami.net/): Free and universal communication platform which preserves the user's privacy and freedoms. Desktop and mobile apps for text messaging, video and audio calls, file transfer, video conferencing.
*   [twtxt (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/getwtxt/getwtxt): Decentralized microblogging platform "for hackers" based on text files. The user is "followed" and "mentioned" by referencing the URL to their twtxt.txt file and a nickname.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • croc (‚≠ê31k): Easily and securely send files and folders from one computer to another in command line.
  • Jami: Free and universal communication platform which preserves the user's privacy and freedoms. Desktop and mobile apps for text messaging, video and audio calls, file transfer, video conferencing.
  • twtxt (‚≠ê48): Decentralized microblogging platform "for hackers" based on text files. The user is "followed" and "mentioned" by referencing the URL to their twtxt.txt file and a nickname.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Aug 06 - Aug 12, 2018
items.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Aug 06 - Aug 12, 2018
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Handshake](https://handshake.org): Decentralized, permissionless naming protocol compatible with DNS where every peer is validating and in charge of managing the root zone with the goal of creating an alternative to existing Certificate Authorities.
*   [Orion (‚≠ê124)](https://github.com/Siderus/Orion): Easy to Use, Inter Planetary File System (IPFS) desktop client.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • Handshake: Decentralized, permissionless naming protocol compatible with DNS where every peer is validating and in charge of managing the root zone with the goal of creating an alternative to existing Certificate Authorities.
  • Orion (‚≠ê124): Easy to Use, Inter Planetary File System (IPFS) desktop client.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Apr 16 - Apr 22, 2018
items.summary: 4 awesome projects updated on Apr 16 - Apr 22, 2018
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [AKASHA](https://akasha.world): A Next-Generation Social Media Network. Powered by the Ethereum world computer. Embedded into the Inter-Planetary File System.
*   [Patchwork (‚≠ê3.6k)](https://github.com/ssbc/patchwork): Decentralized messaging and sharing app built on top of Secure Scuttlebutt (SSB). Another alternative interface is [Patchbay (‚≠ê393)](https://github.com/ssbc/patchbay).
*   [PeerTube (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/Chocobozzz/PeerTube): Video streaming platform using BitTorrent directly in the web browser, with WebTorrent and Angular. Demo server at [peertube.cpy.re](https://peertube.cpy.re).
*   [Syncthing-GTK (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing-gtk): GUI for Syncthing - a continuous file synchronization program.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • AKASHA: A Next-Generation Social Media Network. Powered by the Ethereum world computer. Embedded into the Inter-Planetary File System.
  • Patchwork (‚≠ê3.6k): Decentralized messaging and sharing app built on top of Secure Scuttlebutt (SSB). Another alternative interface is Patchbay (‚≠ê393).
  • PeerTube (‚≠ê14k): Video streaming platform using BitTorrent directly in the web browser, with WebTorrent and Angular. Demo server at peertube.cpy.re.
  • Syncthing-GTK (‚≠ê1.3k): GUI for Syncthing - a continuous file synchronization program.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Nov 06 - Nov 12, 2017
items.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Nov 06 - Nov 12, 2017
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Open Bazaar](https://openbazaar.org): Decentralized network for P2P commerce online - using Bitcoin - that has no fees and no restrictions.
*   [WebTorrent Desktop](https://webtorrent.io/desktop): WebTorrent Desktop is for streaming torrents. It connects to both BitTorrent and WebTorrent peers.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • Open Bazaar: Decentralized network for P2P commerce online - using Bitcoin - that has no fees and no restrictions.
  • WebTorrent Desktop: WebTorrent Desktop is for streaming torrents. It connects to both BitTorrent and WebTorrent peers.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Sep 11 - Sep 17, 2017
items.summary: 4 awesome projects updated on Sep 11 - Sep 17, 2017
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Demonsaw](https://www.demonsaw.com): Secure and anonymous information sharing application that makes security simple and gives you back control of your data.
*   [Ricochet](https://ricochet.im/): Different approach to instant messaging that doesn‚Äôt trust anyone in protecting your privacy. It uses the Tor network.
*   [Tox](https://tox.chat): Instant messaging application, without central servers. The system is distributed, peer-to-peer, and end-to-end encrypted.

### Other

*   [Blockply](https://blockply.com/): Blockply is a collection of the most interesting & outstanding Blockchain projects.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • Demonsaw: Secure and anonymous information sharing application that makes security simple and gives you back control of your data.
  • Ricochet: Different approach to instant messaging that doesn‚Äôt trust anyone in protecting your privacy. It uses the Tor network.
  • Tox: Instant messaging application, without central servers. The system is distributed, peer-to-peer, and end-to-end encrypted.

Other

  • Blockply: Blockply is a collection of the most interesting & outstanding Blockchain projects.

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Feb 20 - Feb 26, 2017
items.summary: 4 awesome projects updated on Feb 20 - Feb 26, 2017
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Beaker](https://beakerbrowser.com): Experimental browser. It adds new technologies for Peer-to-Peer applications while staying compatible with the rest of the Web.
*   [CacheP2P (‚≠ê864)](https://github.com/guerrerocarlos/CacheP2P): highly distributed cache platform based on WebTorrent and runs only in the browser.
*   [Roll-Call](https://rollcall.audio): Free and reliable audio calls for everyone w/ browser P2P.
*   [Storj](https://storj.io): Blockchain-based, end-to-end encrypted, distributed object storage, where only you have access to your data.
items.content_html:
Applications

  • Beaker: Experimental browser. It adds new technologies for Peer-to-Peer applications while staying compatible with the rest of the Web.
  • CacheP2P (‚≠ê864): highly distributed cache platform based on WebTorrent and runs only in the browser.
  • Roll-Call: Free and reliable audio calls for everyone w/ browser P2P.
  • Storj: Blockchain-based, end-to-end encrypted, distributed object storage, where only you have access to your data.

items.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Jan 30 - Feb 05, 2017

Applications

items.title: Awesome Decentralized Updates on Jan 23 - Jan 29, 2017
items.summary: 12 awesome projects updated on Jan 23 - Jan 29, 2017
items.content_text:
### Applications

*   [Bitmessage](https://bitmessage.org): P2P communications protocol used to send encrypted messages to another person or to many subscribers.
*   [Dat desktop app (‚≠ê647)](https://github.com/datproject/dat-desktop): Decentralized data tool for distributing data small and large.
*   [I2P](https://geti2p.net): Anonymous network, exposing a simple layer that applications can use to anonymously and securely send messages to each other.
*   [MaidSafe](https://maidsafe.net): Decentralized internet and app infrastructure which rewards users for participating in the network.

### Other

*   [Blockstack](https://blockstack.org): The new decentralized internet. Platform for application development with built in decentralized DNS.
*   [okTurtles](https://okturtles.com): DNSChain = Secure Blockchain Access and BlockchainID = decentralized web login.

### Related Lists

*   [https://github.com/kgryte/awesome-peer-to-peer (‚≠ê2.5k)](https://github.com/kgryte/awesome-peer-to-peer)
*   [https://github.com/retrohacker/awesome-p2p (‚≠ê151)](https://github.com/retrohacker/awesome-p2p)
*   [https://github.com/Kikobeats/awesome-network-js (‚≠ê564)](https://github.com/Kikobeats/awesome-network-js)
*   [https://github.com/steve-vincent/awesome-decentralized (‚≠ê203)](https://github.com/steve-vincent/awesome-decentralized)
*   [https://github.com/gdamdam/awesome-decentralized-web (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/gdamdam/awesome-decentralized-web)
*   <https://redecentralize.github.io/alternative-internet>
items.content_html:
Applications

  • Bitmessage: P2P communications protocol used to send encrypted messages to another person or to many subscribers.
  • Dat desktop app (‚≠ê647): Decentralized data tool for distributing data small and large.
  • I2P: Anonymous network, exposing a simple layer that applications can use to anonymously and securely send messages to each other.
  • MaidSafe: Decentralized internet and app infrastructure which rewards users for participating in the network.

Other

  • Blockstack: The new decentralized internet. Platform for application development with built in decentralized DNS.
  • okTurtles: DNSChain = Secure Blockchain Access and BlockchainID = decentralized web login.

Related Lists

  • https://github.com/kgryte/awesome-peer-to-peer (‚≠ê2.5k)
  • https://github.com/retrohacker/awesome-p2p (‚≠ê151)
  • https://github.com/Kikobeats/awesome-network-js (‚≠ê564)
  • https://github.com/steve-vincent/awesome-decentralized (‚≠ê203)
  • https://github.com/gdamdam/awesome-decentralized-web (‚≠ê1.6k)
  • https://redecentralize.github.io/alternative-internet
